required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Org 25969 in Elderly Subjects With Adult Subjects (19.4.305)(P05950)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Parallel Group, Comparative, Phase IIIa Trial to Compare the Efficacy, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics of Org 25969 in Elderly Subjects With Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the trial is to compare the effectiveness, safety and pharmacokinetics of Org 25969 in subjects 65 and over with subjects under 65.

primary_outcome.measure: Time from start administration of Org 25969 to recovery T4/T1 ratio to 0.9

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from start administration of Org 25969 to recovery T4/T1 ratio to 0.7 and 0.8; assessment of clinical signs of recovery (level of consciousness, 5-sec head lift, general muscle weakness)

intervention.description: After the intubation dose or last maintenance dose of rocuronium, at reappearance of T2, subjects were to receive a dose of 2.0 mg/kg Org 25969.

link.description: Click here to access a synopsis of the study results.

results_reference.citation: McDonagh DL, Benedict PE, Kovac AL, Drover DR, Brister NW, Morte JB, Monk TG. Efficacy, safety, and pharmacokinetics of sugammadex for the reversal of rocuronium-induced neuromuscular blockade in elderly patients. Anesthesiology. 2011 Feb;114(2):318-29. doi: 10.1097/ALN.0b013e3182065c36.
